name: 02-Data Description and Preparation
content:
Data Description and Preparation

Data Description (from dataset):

Each record corresponds to a cell towerâs attributes and its connectivity with other towers.

Field NameDescriptionTower_IDUnique identifier for each cell tower.Latitude / LongitudeGeographic coordinates of the tower.Neighbor_TowersList or count of adjacent towers.Distance_to_NeighborDistance in km/miles between two towers.Dropped_CallsNumber of dropped calls associated with the tower or neighbor link.Successful_CallsCount of successful call connections.Signal_StrengthAverage signal strength rating for the tower.Network_LoadCurrent or historical usage load on the tower.Best_Match_TowerTarget variable indicating the tower selected for diversion.

Data Preparation Steps:

Data Cleaning:

  • Handle missing coordinates, dropped/failed call counts.
  • Normalize signal strength and load metrics.

Feature Engineering:

  • Compute connectivity success ratio = Successful Calls / (Successful + Dropped Calls).
  • Derive distance-weighted connectivity score combining geography and call success.
  • Aggregate neighbor statistics (average dropped calls per neighbor).

Transformation:

  • Standardize distance and load features for optimization.
  • Encode categorical attributes (e.g., tower IDs).

Splitting:

  • Partition into training and validation datasets for evaluation.
